p: Moreover, a comparison between the effects of the aqueous and methanolic stem bark extracts of P. thonningii in xylene-induced ear oedema was done. The results showed that the experimental mice administered the aqueous stem bark extract of this plant, at all the studied dose levels, showed significantly higher percentage inhibitions of oedema compared with the inhibitions in mice that received the methanolic extract at all the studied dose levels ( p < 0.05; Figure 3).
